item.title: ZD-915 desoldering station review
item.description: My electronics hobby sometimes requires me to desolder components – mostly traditional through-hole components – off of printed circuit boards. Since this hasn’t been such a frequent occurrence, however, so far I’ve got by by using desoldering wick and one of those spring-operated desoldering pumps. Recently though I wanted to salvage a power supply from a diseased tape deck for a project I was working on. Having done this, I was left with a PCB full of potentially useful components.
